https://github.com/Icinga/icinga2.description: The core of our monitoring platform with a powerful configuration language and REST API.

https://github.com/Juniper/jsnapy.description: Python version of Junos Snapshot Administrator

https://github.com/StackStorm/st2.description: StackStorm (aka "IFTTT for Ops") is event-driven automation for auto-remediation, incident responses, troubleshooting, deployments, and more for DevOps and SREs. Includes rules engine, workflow, 160 integration packs with 6000+ actions (see https://exchange.stackstorm.org) and ChatOps. Installer at https://docs.stackstorm.com/install/index.html

https://github.com/akarneliuk/pygnmi.description: The pure Python implementation of the gNMI client.

https://github.com/ansible-semaphore/sem.description: Modern UI and powerful API for Ansible, Terraform/OpenTofu/Terragrunt, PowerShell and other DevOps tools.

https://github.com/ansible/ansible.description: Ansible is a radically simple IT automation platform that makes your applications and systems easier to deploy and maintain. Automate everything from code deployment to network configuration to cloud management, in a language that approaches plain English, using SSH, with no agents to install on remote systems. https://docs.ansible.com.

https://github.com/ansible/awx.description: AWX provides a web-based user interface, REST API, and task engine built on top of Ansible. It is one of the upstream projects for Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform.

https://github.com/apache/airflow.description: Apache Airflow - A platform to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor workflows

https://github.com/aristanetworks/anta.description: What do you call an ant with frogs legs?

https://github.com/batfish/batfish.description: Batfish is a network configuration analysis tool that can find bugs and guarantee the correctness of (planned or current) network configurations. It enables network engineers to rapidly and safely evolve their network, without fear of outages or security breaches.

https://github.com/carlmontanari/scrapli.description: Fast, flexible, sync/async, Python 3.9+ screen scraping client specifically for network devices

https://github.com/carverauto/servicerad.description: powerful opensource network management and observability platform

https://github.com/cisco-open/jalapeno.description: An infrastructure platform for network services

https://github.com/eNMS-automation/eNMS.description: An enterprise-grade vendor-agnostic network automation platform.

https://github.com/gruntwork-io/terragru.description: Terragrunt is a flexible orchestration tool that allows Infrastructure as Code written in OpenTofu/Terraform to scale.

https://github.com/influxdata/telegraf.description: Agent for collecting, processing, aggregating, and writing metrics, logs, and other arbitrary data.

https://github.com/ipspace/netlab.description: Making virtual networking labs suck less

https://github.com/ktbyers/netmiko.description: Multi-vendor library to simplify Paramiko SSH connections to network devices

https://github.com/leg100/otf.description: An open source alternative to terraform enterprise.

https://github.com/mikefarah/yq.description: yq is a portable command-line YAML, JSON, XML, CSV, TOML  and properties processor

https://github.com/napalm-automation/nap.description: Network Automation and Programmability Abstraction Layer with Multivendor support

https://github.com/nautobot/nautobot.description: Network Source of Truth & Network Automation Platform

https://github.com/netbox-community/netb.description: The premier source of truth powering network automation. Open source under Apache 2. Try NetBox Cloud free: https://netboxlabs.com/products/free-netbox-cloud/

https://github.com/network-unit-testing-.description: NUTS defines a desired network state and checks it against a real network using pytest and nornir.

https://github.com/networktocode/diffsyn.description: A utility library for comparing and synchronizing different datasets.

https://github.com/networktocode/netutil.description: Python library that is a collection of functions and objects for common network automation tasks.

https://github.com/networktocode/ntc-tem.description: TextFSM templates for parsing show commands of network devices

https://github.com/nornir-automation/nor.description: Pluggable multi-threaded framework with inventory management to help operate collections of devices

https://github.com/openconfig/gnmic.description: gNMIc is a gNMI CLI client and collector

https://github.com/openconfig/ygot.description: A YANG-centric Go toolkit - Go/Protobuf Code Generation; Validation; Marshaling/Unmarshaling

https://github.com/opentofu/opentofu.description: OpenTofu lets you declaratively manage your cloud infrastructure.

https://github.com/opsmill/infrahub.description: Infrahub offers a central hub to manage the data, templates and playbooks that powers your infrastructure by combining the version control and branch management capabilities of Git with the flexible data model and UI of a graph database.

https://github.com/orb-community/orb.description: Orb is a dynamic network observability platform with agent fleet orchestration and data pipelines with OpenTelemetry

https://github.com/prometheus/prometheus.description: The Prometheus monitoring system and time series database.

https://github.com/pydantify/pydantify.description: Transform YANG models into pydantic datastructures

https://github.com/robotframework/robotf.description: Generic automation framework for acceptance testing and RPA

https://github.com/robshakir/pyangbind.description: A plugin for pyang that creates Python bindings for a YANG model.

https://github.com/saltstack/salt.description: Software to automate the management and configuration of infrastructure and applications at scale.

https://github.com/sbezverk/gobmp.description: go based implementation of BGP's BMP protocol

https://github.com/workfloworchestrator/.description: The SURF ultimate Provider Agent (SuPA) implements the Connection Service (CS) version 2.1 protocol that enables the reservation, creation, management and removal of network circuits (connections) that transit several networks managed by different providers.
Example orchestrator UI based on the orchestrator-ui-library
Component library for the orchestrator-ui (v2) which is published in npm
Define JSON scheme with pydantic so a frontend can generate forms with pydantic validators

https://github.com/zabbix/zabbix.description: Real-time monitoring of IT components and services, such as networks, servers, VMs, applications and the cloud.
https://github.com/zabbix/zabbix.license: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

items.name: Netbox Community
items.description: NetBox is the leading solution for modeling and documenting modern networks.

summary.business_use_case: Provides centralized network intended state and documentation as well as IPAM and DCIM and scripting functionality.
summary.integration: IP Fabric, Slurpit

items.name: InfraHub
items.description: Infrahub from OpsMill is taking a new approach to Infrastructure Management by providing a new generation of datastore to organize and control all the data that defines how an infrastructure should run. Infrahub offers a central hub to manage the data, templates and playbooks that powers your infrastructure by combining the version control and branch management capabilities of Git with the flexible data model and UI of a graph database.

summary.use_case: Network infrastructure modeling, automation integration

items.name: Nautobot
items.description: Nautobot is a Network Source of Truth and Network Automation Platform.

summary.business_use_case: Improves network operations efficiency and reduces errors through centralized network management and automation
summary.integration: Integrates with various automation tools and supports custom plugins
summary.release_rate: Regular releases with long-term support versions
summary.use_case: Provides a centralized network inventory management and automation platform with extensible data models and Git-based version control

items.name: Peering Manager
items.description: Peering Manager is a BGP management tool

summary.business_use_case: Improves BGP peering with other networks and reduces errors through automation
summary.use_case: Provides a source of truth and configuration management for external BGP sessions of all kind (transit, customers, peering, )

items.name: Netdisco
items.description: Netdisco is a web-based network management tool suitable for small to very large networks. IP and MAC address data is collected into a PostgreSQL database using SNMP, CLI, or device APIs.

summary.business_use_case: Network discovery and inventory of networks, with some historical data
summary.use_case: Discovery and inventory

items.name: ServiceRadar
items.description: ServiceRadar is an open-source, distributed network monitoring system designed for security and performance in constrained or hard-to-reach environments. It uses a zero-trust architecture with lightweight agents to provide real-time monitoring, alerting, and network discovery.

summary.business_use_case: Provides secure, comprehensive visibility into distributed networks without introducing new attack vectors. Reduces downtime and operational costs in environments where traditional monitoring is unfeasible or insecure.
summary.integration: Webhooks, Custom gRPC-based checkers, NetBox, Armis, MCP
summary.use_case: Real-time, secure monitoring of distributed infrastructure, network devices via SNMP, and services, with a focus on edge computing and hard-to-reach environments.

items.name: Batfish
items.description: A network configuration analysis tool that builds a mathematical model of network behavior, allowing for advanced querying and validation.

summary.business_use_case: Reduces network outages and security vulnerabilities by catching misconfigurations before deployment
summary.integration: Ansible, Terraform, CI/CD pipelines
summary.use_case: Performs network configuration analysis, validation, and troubleshooting without the need for live network access

items.name: anta
items.description: Arista Network Test Automation (ANTA) Framework is a Python framework that automates tests for Arista devices.

summary.business_use_case: Improves network reliability and reduces operational costs by automating the testing and validation of Arista network infrastructures
summary.integration: Integrates with Arista EOS (Extensible Operating System) and supports various testing scenarios
summary.release_rate: Regularly updated with new features and improvements
summary.use_case: Provides a Python-based framework for automating tests on Arista network devices, enabling efficient validation of network configurations and operations

items.name: Ondatra
items.description: Ondatra (Open Network Device Automated Test Runner and API) is a framework for writing and running tests against both real and containerized network devices.

summary.business_use_case: Improves network reliability and reduces time-to-market for network changes by facilitating comprehensive automated testing
summary.integration: Compatible with OpenConfig data models and various network device platforms
summary.use_case: Enables writing and running automated tests for network devices, supporting both physical and containerized environments

items.name: NUTS
items.description: NUTS (Network Unit Testing System) is a Pytest plugin enabling network testing using YAML files.

summary.business_use_case: Improves network reliability and reduces downtime by enabling comprehensive and easy-to-write network tests
summary.integration: PyTest
summary.use_case: Simplifies network testing by allowing engineers to write tests in YAML format using a PyTest plugin

items.name: Robot Framework
items.description: Robot Framework is an open-source automation framework for test automation and robotic process automation (RPA). It is supported by the Robot Framework Foundation and widely used in the industry.

summary.business_use_case: Robot Framework is operating system and application independent. It is implemented using Python which is also the primary language to extend it. The framework has a rich ecosystem around it consisting of various generic libraries and tools that are developed as separate projects.
summary.integration: Python
summary.use_case: Robot Framework is a generic open source automation framework for acceptance testing, acceptance test driven development (ATDD), and robotic process automation (RPA). It has simple plain text syntax and it can be extended easily with generic and custom libraries.

items.name: Junos Snapshot Administrator
items.description: Junos Snapshot Administrator enables you to capture and audit runtime environment snapshots of your networked devices running the Junos operating system (Junos OS).

summary.business_use_case: JSNAPy will help you collect data to check and verify it; Automate the verification of data intelligently and quickly; Simplify the whole process of data collection and verification; Customize and integrate network verification into your existing network systems.
summary.integration: Juniper, Python
summary.use_case: JSNAPy is an evolution of the original JSNAP module: the nextgen module for automating network verification. Not only has JSNAPy simplified data collection, it has also reduced the amount of effort needed for verification, and that means your late night cut overs just got a lot shorter, safer, and completely verified.

items.name: ServiceRadar
items.description: ServiceRadar is an open-source, distributed network monitoring system designed for security and performance in constrained or hard-to-reach environments. It uses a zero-trust architecture with lightweight agents to provide real-time monitoring, alerting, and network discovery.

summary.business_use_case: Provides secure, comprehensive visibility into distributed networks without introducing new attack vectors. Reduces downtime and operational costs in environments where traditional monitoring is unfeasible or insecure.
summary.integration: Webhooks, Custom gRPC-based checkers, NetBox, Armis, MCP
summary.use_case: Real-time, secure monitoring of distributed infrastructure, network devices via SNMP, and services, with a focus on edge computing and hard-to-reach environments.

items.name: Orb Community
items.description: Orb is an open-source observability platform that provides a unified view of metrics, logs, and traces. It aims to simplify the complexities of observability by offering an integrated solution for monitoring and troubleshooting distributed systems.

summary.business_use_case: Enables organizations to gain comprehensive insights into their systems' performance and behavior, reducing mean time to detection and resolution of issues
summary.integration: Supports various data sources and protocols including Prometheus, OpenTelemetry, and InfluxDB
summary.use_case: Unified observability platform for metrics, logs, and traces in distributed systems

items.name: Icinga
items.description: Monitoring system which checks the availability of your network resources, notifies users of outages, and generates performance data for reporting.

summary.business_use_case: Ensures high availability and performance of IT infrastructure, integrates with NetBox
summary.use_case: Provides comprehensive monitoring for network resources, services, and applications

items.name: LibreNMS
items.description: A fully featured network monitoring system that provides a wealth of features and device support.

summary.business_use_case: Provides comprehensive network visibility and monitoring, enabling organizations to proactively manage their network infrastructure and quickly identify and resolve issues
summary.integration: Oxidized, Smokeping, NFSen, Weathermap
summary.use_case: Network device monitoring, performance tracking, alerting, and reporting

items.name: eNMS
items.description: eNMS is a vendor-agnostic NMS designed for building workflow-based network automation solutions, with a focus on visualization, inventory management, and service scheduling.

summary.business_use_case: Streamlines network operations by providing a centralized platform for network automation, visualization, and management, improving efficiency and reducing manual errors
summary.integration: Supports integration with various network devices and protocols, as well as external services like Ansible, Netmiko, and NAPALM
summary.release_rate: Regular updates with new features and improvements
summary.use_case: Network automation, workflow management, network visualization, and inventory management

items.name: Prometheus
items.description: An open-source systems monitoring and alerting toolkit, popular in cloud-native environments but also very applicable to network monitoring.

summary.business_use_case: Enables organizations to gain real-time insights into system performance, detect anomalies quickly, and maintain high service reliability
summary.integration: Grafana, Alertmanager, various exporters for different systems and services
summary.use_case: Network performance monitoring, alerting, service level indicator (SLI) tracking

items.name: Zabbix
items.description: An enterprise-class open source distributed monitoring solution for networks and applications.

summary.business_use_case: Provides comprehensive infrastructure monitoring, helping organizations detect and resolve IT issues quickly, optimize performance, and plan for future growth
summary.integration: SNMP, IPMI, JMX, VMware monitoring
summary.release_rate: Major releases annually, with minor releases more frequently
summary.use_case: Network device monitoring, performance tracking, capacity planning

items.name: Netos NetOps
items.description: Built with Ansible Semaphore, the Netos NetOps project lays the foundation to install and manage NetBox, and other network tools.

summary.business_use_case: Deliver consistent development, test, and production network automation tooling, through automation.
summary.integration: Deploy Ansible, Python, and bash scripts to integrate with any computer system.
summary.use_case: A framework that makes it simple and fast to deploy and manage open-source enterprise networking applications and tools.

items.name: Telegraf
items.description: Telegraf is a plugin-driven server agent for collecting and reporting metrics. It has integrations to source a variety of metrics, events, and logs directly from containers and systems it's running on, as well as pulling metrics from third-party APIs.

summary.business_use_case: Enhances system and application observability by providing a flexible, extensible solution for collecting and forwarding metrics, enabling better decision-making and faster problem resolution
summary.integration: Integrates with numerous input sources (e.g., systems, containers, APIs) and output destinations (e.g., InfluxDB, Prometheus, Kafka)
summary.release_rate: Regular releases with new features, plugins, and bug fixes
summary.use_case: Collects metrics from a wide variety of sources and writes them to various destinations, enabling comprehensive monitoring and observability of systems and applications

items.name: gNMIc
items.description: gNMIc is a full-featured gNMI-focused streaming telemetry collector with rich data processing capabilities and high-availability support.

summary.use_case: gNMI-based network device management, telemetry collection

items.name: jalapeno
items.description: A cloud-native infrastructure platform to enable development of network services collecting telemetry with GoBMP and Telegraf.

summary.use_case: Developing Cloud Native Network Services (CNNS) on top of common data collection and warehousing infrastructure.

items.name: jagw
items.description: The Jalapeo API Gateway offers you a simple and easy to use way to access the data provided by the Jalapeo application stack.

summary.use_case: Developing Cloud Native Network Services (CNNS) to collect or subscribe Jalapeno data/events

items.name: goBMP
items.description: goBMP is an implementation of Open BMP (RFC 7854) protocol's collector in go language. Collected BGP information can be published to kafka topics, stored in the file in JSON format or printed to stdout.

summary.integration: kafka
summary.use_case: Collecting BGP Monitoring metrics

items.name: bbmp2kafka
items.description: bbmk2pafka is an Open Source BGP Monitoring Protocol (BMP, RFC7854) receiver based on the Bio-Routing BGP/BMP library, designed to forward all BMP Monitoring messages, so specifically BGP UPDATEs and WITHDRAWs, onto a Kafka stream as protobuf messages.

summary.integration: kafka
summary.use_case: Collecting BGP Monitoring metrics

items.name: GNS3
items.description: GNS3 is a network software emulator that allows the combination of virtual and real devices.

items.name: Containerlab
items.description: Nokia Containerlab is a container-based network emulation tool that allows you to define and deploy complex network topologies.

items.name: netlab
items.description: netlab is a network lab builder and CLI tool that creates virtual network labs using libvirt, Docker, or Podman containers. It supports multiple virtualization providers and network operating systems.

summary.business_use_case: Accelerates network testing and development processes by providing an easy-to-use platform for creating realistic network environments without the need for physical hardware
summary.integration: Supports various virtualization providers (libvirt, Docker, Podman) and multiple network operating systems
summary.release_rate: Regularly updated with new features and device support
summary.use_case: Enables network engineers and developers to quickly create and manage virtual network topologies for testing, development, and learning purposes

items.name: NRX
items.description: NRX (netreplica exporter) is a network topology exporter that reads network topology graphs from NetBox DCIM system and exports them to various formats including Containerlab, Cisco Modeling Labs, network visualization formats, and custom formats via Jinja2 templates.

summary.business_use_case: Accelerates lab creation and testing by automatically generating lab topologies from existing network documentation, reducing manual effort and errors in test environment setup
summary.integration: NetBox, Containerlab, Cisco Modeling Labs, Nvidia Air, Graphite, D2, Cytoscape
summary.release_rate: Regular releases with new features and format support
summary.use_case: Export network topologies from NetBox to lab automation tools like Containerlab and CML, create network visualizations, and bridge the gap between network documentation and lab automation

items.name: Ansible
items.description: Ansible is a simple, agentless IT automation platform that makes your applications and systems easier to deploy. It's particularly popular in network automation for its ease of use and extensive module library.

summary.business_use_case: Simplifies complex IT workflows, reduces manual errors, and improves operational efficiency across diverse IT environments
summary.integration: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, VMware, Cisco, Juniper, F5, Arista
summary.release_rate: Major releases approximately every 6 months, with minor releases more frequently
summary.use_case: Network configuration management, compliance automation, bulk changes

items.name: OpenTofu
items.description: OpenTofu is an infrastructure as code tool that lets you define both cloud and on-prem resources in human-readable configuration files that you can version, reuse, and share.

summary.business_use_case: Enables infrastructure as code, improving consistency, reducing errors, and speeding up deployment across multiple cloud providers and on-premises infrastructure
summary.integration: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, VMware, Cisco ACI, F5, Palo Alto Networks
summary.use_case: Cloud network provisioning, multi-cloud networking, SDN configuration

items.name: Salt
items.description: Salt is a powerful and flexible open-source software for remote execution, configuration management, and infrastructure orchestration. It's gaining popularity in network automation for its speed and scalability.

summary.business_use_case: Provides scalable infrastructure automation and configuration management for large-scale network environments
summary.integration: Ansible, Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes
summary.use_case: Large-scale network configuration management, real-time system monitoring, and infrastructure orchestration

items.name: Semaphore UI
items.description: Semaphore UI is a powerful and user-friendly interface designed to manage Ansible automation projects efficiently. It provides a graphical user interface to simplify running, scheduling, and managing Ansible playbooks, making automation accessible to teams of all sizes.

summary.business_use_case: Semaphore UI increases efficiency in automation by providing a centralized tool to control and monitor Ansible playbook executions, reducing human errors and streamlining operational workflows.
summary.integration: Works seamlessly with Ansible playbooks, Git repositories for version control, and supports SSH-based connections to remote systems for task execution.
summary.release_rate: Regular updates to improve automation features and enhance user interface capabilities.
summary.use_case: Managing and scheduling Ansible playbooks through a simple and intuitive interface, helping teams automate infrastructure management and application deployment.

items.name: AWX
items.description: AWX is the open source upstream project for Red Hat Ansible Automation Platform. It provides a web-based user interface, REST API, and task engine for Ansible.

summary.business_use_case: Provides a user-friendly interface for managing Ansible automation, enabling easier adoption and management of automation across organizations
summary.integration: Ansible, Git, various cloud platforms
summary.use_case: Centralized automation management, team collaboration, audit trails

items.name: Apache Airflow
items.description: Apache Airflow is an open-source platform that allows for the programmatic creation, scheduling, and monitoring of workflows. It is widely used for orchestrating complex data pipelines and automating tasks across a wide range of industries.

summary.business_use_case: Airflow improves operational efficiency by automating tasks and ensuring seamless integration of data sources, enabling faster and more reliable delivery of insights.
summary.integration: Supports integration with databases, APIs, cloud services, and external systems to create a unified workflow environment.
summary.release_rate: Regular updates aligned with the latest advancements in data orchestration and cloud technologies.
summary.use_case: Orchestrating and scheduling data pipelines, managing ETL processes, and automating complex workflows across diverse environments.

items.name: StackStorm
items.description: StackStorm (aka "IFTTT for Ops") is event-driven automation for auto-remediation, incident responses, troubleshooting, deployments, and more for DevOps and SREs

items.name: Workflow Orchestrator
items.description: The Workflow Orchestrator is a framework of tools that help the developer create workflow to modify the lifecycle of subscribed products. It is un-opinionated in what it can orchestrate, but very opinionated in how. The Orchestrator is designed to run linear workflows that represent the business process of delivering a product.

summary.business_use_case: Use a Service Provider Product model to orchestrator automated processes across your organization. Not limited to, but useful for deploying and tracking state of network configuration products, business and security processes.
summary.integration: Any system which exposes and API and can be reached or integrated via Python code
summary.use_case: Production ready Workflow Orchestration Framework to manage product lifecycle and workflows. Easy to use, Built on top of FastAPI

items.name: yq
items.description: yq is a portable command-line YAML, JSON, XML, CSV and properties processor. It's written in Go and works seamlessly across platforms with consistent, intuitive syntax for data manipulation and transformation.

summary.business_use_case: Enables efficient configuration management and data transformation in DevOps workflows, reducing manual errors and improving automation reliability
summary.integration: Command-line tools, shell scripts, CI/CD systems, Docker containers
summary.release_rate: Regular releases with new features and improvements
summary.use_case: Process, query, and transform YAML, JSON, XML files in automation scripts and CI/CD pipelines

items.name: jq
items.description: jq is a lightweight and flexible command-line JSON processor. It's like sed for JSON data - you can use it to slice and filter and map and transform structured data with the same ease that sed, awk, grep give you for text.

summary.business_use_case: Essential tool for processing API responses, configuration files, and structured data in modern DevOps and automation environments
summary.integration: REST APIs, shell scripts, CI/CD pipelines, log processing systems
summary.release_rate: Stable releases with periodic updates and bug fixes
summary.use_case: Parse, filter, and transform JSON data in scripts, APIs, and automation workflows

items.name: Open Terraforming Framework (OTF)
items.description: OTF is an open-source alternative to Terraform Enterprise, sharing many of its features including full Terraform CLI integration, remote execution mode, agent execution mode, remote state backend, SSO, RBAC, VCS integration, and compatibility with much of the Terraform Enterprise/Cloud API.

summary.business_use_case: Provides enterprise Terraform features including SSO, team management, agents, and no per-resource pricing, enabling organizations to manage infrastructure as code at scale without vendor lock-in
summary.integration: Terraform, OpenTofu, GitHub, OAuth
summary.use_case: Self-hosted Terraform Enterprise alternative, team collaboration, workspace management, remote state backend

items.name: Terragrunt
items.description: Terragrunt is a thin wrapper that provides extra tools for keeping your configurations DRY, working with multiple Terraform modules, and managing remote state.

summary.business_use_case: Reduces code duplication in Terraform configurations, simplifies multi-environment deployments, and provides better organization for complex infrastructure projects
summary.integration: Terraform, OpenTofu, AWS, Azure, GCP, various Terraform providers
summary.use_case: DRY Terraform configurations, remote state management, multi-module orchestration, dependency management

items.name: pygohcl
items.description: Python wrapper for hashicorp/hcl (v2). Provides Python bindings to parse HCL (HashiCorp Configuration Language) files, commonly used with Terraform configurations.

summary.business_use_case: Enables Python-based automation tools to read and process Terraform configuration files, facilitating integration between infrastructure-as-code workflows and network automation systems
summary.integration: Terraform, Python automation frameworks, infrastructure-as-code pipelines
summary.release_rate: Regular updates with Python version support
summary.use_case: Parse and process HCL/Terraform configuration files from Python applications, enabling integration of Terraform configurations into network automation workflows

items.name: Atlantis
items.description: Atlantis is a tool for collaborating on Terraform through GitHub, GitLab and Bitbucket. It allows teams to review and approve Terraform changes through pull requests, enabling safer and more collaborative infrastructure changes. While pioneering GitOps workflows, it has significant scaling limitations and single-server architecture bottlenecks that make it unsuitable for large teams.

summary.business_use_case: Enables safe collaborative Terraform workflows through pull request-based reviews, reducing deployment risks and improving team coordination for infrastructure changes. However, scaling limitations and operational overhead make it less suitable for enterprise environments.
summary.integration: GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, Terraform, Slack, webhooks, various CI/CD systems
summary.use_case: Terraform pull request automation, collaborative infrastructure changes, Terraform plan/apply workflow automation for small to medium teams

items.name: TofuPy
items.description: TofuPy is a Python wrapper library around OpenTofu and Terraform that provides a high-level interface for Infrastructure as Code operations. It handles JSON output parsing, provides structured data objects, and supports streaming events for plan and apply operations.

summary.use_case: Infrastructure as Code automation, OpenTofu/Terraform wrapper, programmatic infrastructure management, security scanning of infrastructure plans

items.name: NAPALM (Network Automation and Programmability Abstraction Layer with Multivendor support)
items.description: NAPALM is a Python library that implements a set of functions to interact with different network device Operating Systems using a unified API.

summary.business_use_case: Simplifies multi-vendor network management, reduces complexity in network automation, and improves operational efficiency
summary.integration: Ansible, Salt, Nornir, Netbox
summary.use_case: Network device configuration, state retrieval, configuration compliance

items.name: Nornir
items.description: Nornir is a pure Python automation framework that can be used for network automation tasks. It's designed to be fast, flexible, and easy to extend.

summary.business_use_case: Enables efficient and scalable network automation, reducing manual tasks and improving network management productivity
summary.integration: NAPALM, Netmiko, Scrapli, Paramiko
summary.use_case: Rapid network data collection, configuration deployment, custom automation workflows

items.name: NORFAB (Network Automation Fabric)
items.description: NORFAB is a framework for extreme network automations that acts as a glue bringing network automation tools together.

summary.business_use_case: Simplify and enhance network automation, empower engineers, address mundane tasks
summary.integration: Nornir, Netbox, NAPALM, SCRAPLI, ROBOT, Containerlab, Netmiko, FastAPI etc.
summary.use_case: Network configuration, network testing, network reporting

items.name: Scrapli
items.description: Scrapli is a Python library focused on connecting to network devices (routers/switches/firewalls/etc.) via Telnet or SSH. It aims to be fast, flexible, and easy to use for both synchronous and asynchronous operations.

summary.use_case: Network device automation, configuration management, data retrieval from network devices

items.name: Netmiko
items.description: Netmiko is a multi-vendor library to simplify Paramiko SSH connections to network devices. It provides a unified API to connect to various network devices.

summary.use_case: Network device connection and configuration, multi-vendor support

items.name: PyEZ
items.description: Juniper PyEZ is a Python library for managing and automating Juniper devices. It provides a Pythonic interface to the NETCONF API and other management interfaces.

summary.use_case: Juniper device automation, configuration management, operational state retrieval

items.name: pyeapi
items.description: The Python Client for eAPI (pyeapi) is a native Python library wrapper around Arista EOS eAPI.

summary.use_case: Arista device automation, configuration management, operational state retrieval

items.name: NTC Templates
items.description: Repository of TextFSM Templates for Network Devices, and Python wrapper for TextFSM's CliTable. TextFSM is a tool to help make parsing cli commands more manageable.

summary.use_case: Parsing outputs from network devices

items.name: TTP
items.description: Template Text Parser is a Python library for semi-structured text parsing using templates.

summary.use_case: Parsing outputs from semi-structured text

items.name: netutils
items.description: Collection of functions that are used in the common network automation tasks.

summary.use_case: Tasks such as converting a BGP ASN to and from dotted format, normalizing an interface name, or 'type 5' encrypting a password.

items.name: ncclient
items.description: ncclient is a Python library that facilitates client-side scripting and application development around the NETCONF protocol.

summary.use_case: NETCONF client to interact with network devices with NETCONF RPCs

items.name: DiffSync
items.description: DiffSync is a utility library that can be used to compare and synchronize different datasets.

summary.use_case: DiffSync is at its most useful when you have multiple sources or sets of data to compare and/or synchronize

items.name: ncdiff
items.description: Extended ncclient NETCONF client with diff capabilities.

summary.use_case: Send and get NETCONF RPCs and diff, combine or pedict configurations

items.name: pyGNMI
items.description: Python gNMI client

summary.use_case: gNMI-based network device management, telemetry collection

items.name: PyangBind
items.description: Pyang plugin to create Python bindings for a YANG model.

summary.use_case: PyangBind converts YANG models into Python classes, enabling easy programmatic interaction with network configurations for automation and management.

items.name: pydantify
items.description: Transform YANG models into Pydantic datastructures that can be initialized with config values and serialized.

summary.use_case: Pydantify enables seamless conversion of YANG models into Pydantic data structures, allowing for easy initialization, validation, and serialization of network configuration data in a Pythonic way.

items.name: PySROS
items.description: The pySROS libraries provide a model-driven management interface for Python developers to integrate with supported Nokia routers running the Service Router Operating System (SR OS).

summary.use_case: Nokia device automation, configuration management, operational state retrieval

items.name: Hierarchical Configuration
items.description: Query and compare network device configurations. Build remediation and rollback configs too.

summary.business_use_case: Build remediation configurations to power network configuration compliance workflows.
summary.use_case: Load network device running and generated configs. Then, build remediation and rollback configs.

items.name: AVD
items.description: AVD (Arista Validated Designs) is an Ansible collection that can be used also as a python standalone library (PyAVD) developed by Arista Networks. It provides a set of roles and modules to automate the deployment and management of Arista EOS-based network infrastructures.

summary.use_case: Network device automation, configuration management, IaC, declarative configuration

items.name: gornir
items.description: Gornir is a pluggable framework with inventory management to help operate collections of devices. It's similar to nornir but in golang.

summary.business_use_case: Enables efficient and scalable network automation, reducing manual tasks and improving network management productivity
summary.use_case: Rapid network data collection, configuration deployment, custom automation workflows

items.name: ScrapliGo
items.description: Scrapligo is a Go library focused on connecting to devices, specifically network devices (routers/switches/firewalls/etc.) via SSH and NETCONF.

summary.use_case: Network device automation, configuration management, data retrieval from network devices

items.name: gNMIc
items.description: gNMIc is a gNMI-focused software suite that provides a CLI client, a Go API for gNMI and a streaming telemetry collector implementation.

summary.use_case: gNMI-based network device management, telemetry collection

items.name: ygot
items.description: A YANG-centric Go toolkit - Go/Protobuf Code Generation; Validation; Marshaling/Unmarshaling

summary.use_case: Conversion of YANG models into Go and Protobuf code, enabling efficient network configuration management, validation, and telemetry collection in Go-based environments.

items.name: netrasp
items.description: Netrasp is a package that communicates to network devices over SSH. It takes care of handling the pty terminal of network devices giving you an API with common actions such as executing commands and configuring devices.

summary.use_case: Network device connection and configuration, multi-vendor support

items.name: Nautobot Golden Config
items.description: The Golden Config App is a Nautobot App that provides a NetDevOps approach to golden configuration and configuration compliance.

summary.business_use_case: Provides complete configuration management of network devices and more.
summary.integration: Nautobot
summary.use_case: Provides a NetDevOps approach to Golden Configuration and Configuration Compliance with generation/deployment capabilities to remediate config drift.
